MainFuse.infoText: This value is only applicable should a CT clamp be connected for dynamic load balancing purposes on single phase installations.

RFIDReader1Enabled.infoText: If your client wishes to disable the RFID reader, set this field to 'false'.

ChargePointCurrentLimit.infoText: This value should not exceed the rating of the overcurrent protective device / incoming cable to the chargepoint. If the chargepoint has multiple sockets, this value will be shared between them.

MaxCurrentConnection.infoText: This is the maximum charge rate per socket.

PhaseRotation.infoText: Please select the electrical phase this chargepoint is being fed from.

NetworkInterface.infoText: Please ensure your chosen method of connectivity is tested and has sufficient strength prior to selection.

WifiSSID.infoText: Enter the SSID for the Wifi network you are connecting to.

WifiPassKey.infoText: Enter the password for the Wifi network you are connecting to.

WifiRSSi.infoText:
Strength Indicator: 
-30: Amazing, 
-67: Very Good, 
-70: OK, 
-80: Not Good, 
-90: Unusable.

WifiMACAddress.infoText: Enter the WiFi MAC address for the ethernet network you are connecting to.

EthernetMACAddress.infoText: Enter the Ethernet MAC address for the ethernet network you are connecting to.

GPRSAPN.infoText: All units have a pre-installed sim card and the APN is pre-configured by Rolec EV. You / your client will need to make contact with Rolec EV to pay and activate the data connection. If an alternative sim card is to be utilised, please enter the relevant APN.

GPRSPassword.infoText: Do not amend unless instructed to do so by an alternative sim card provider.

LEDActive.infoText: If your client wishes to disable the LED status indicator(s), set value to 'false'.

OfflineMode.infoText: When set to 'true', in the event of a loss of connectivity to a network the chargepoint will operate on a plug and charge basis.

UnlockConnectorOnEVSideDisconnect.infoText: If your client wishes to lock the charging cable into the charging socket in-between charging sessions, set the value to 'false'. The cable must be unplugged on a regular basis, allowing the connectors to be checked for damage or contamination.
